```{r setup}
library(mikropml)
library(tictoc)
```

By default, the `run_ml` function only uses one core.
```{r series}
tic()
result1 <- run_ml(otu_small, 'regLogistic', seed = 2019)
toc()
```

If you'd like to parallelize the cross-validation step with multiple cores,
use the `setup_parallel` function to specify how many cores you have available
prior to calling `run_ml`.
```{r parallel}
setup_parallel(2)
tic()
result2 <- run_ml(otu_small, 'regLogistic', seed = 2019)
toc()
```

This uses the `future::multiprocess` plan to split the work across multiple cores.
You will need to have the `foreach`, `future`, `doFuture`, and `parallel` packages installed to use this feature.
